title: Merci pour le chocolat (2000) - Chabrol
description:
Claude Chabrol directed this well-crafted thriller, which recalls the style and themes of his best-known work of the 1960s. After their divorce, AndrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© married a woman named Lisabeth and they had a son, Guillaume (Rodolphe Pauly), whom AndrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© was left to raise alone after Lisabeth's death in an auto accident. One of AndrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â©'s favorite stories is how Guillaume was almost exchanged for another baby at the hospital shortly after he was born; one day AndrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© receives a visit from a young woman named Jeanne (Anna Mouglalis), who claims to be the other child. Jeanne and AndrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â© soon find they have a remarkable amount in common, and that Jeanne bears a striking resemblance to the late Lisabeth. Jeanne is beginning to wonder if there's something no one has ever told her when Mika gives her a thermos of special hot chocolate as a nightcap, which she then spills all over Jeanne. Jeanne's boyfriend, Axel (Mathieu Simonet), facetiously suggests that the cocoa might be poisoned, and out of curiosity, he tests it, finding that it has indeed been laced with a sedative notorious for its use in cases of date rape. Merci Pour le Chocolat is based on a novel by American crime novelist Charlotte Armstrong.
